data.text:
Families are a lifeline for many during these difficult & uncertain times. 

On Saturday's International #DayofFamilies, join us in celebrating families in all their diversity! https://t.co/6BKCagGp4d https://t.co/aLM60m48sP

Independent human rights experts are deeply distressed by excessive & unlawful use of force against peaceful demonstrators, human rights defenders & journalists across Colombia, and call for government to conduct thorough & impartial investigation.
https://t.co/NBGIjo7v6Q

Being apart from loved ones due to #COVID19 can be hard, but families are finding ways to stay connected. 

Saturday's International #DayOfFamilies celebrates the care, support & love families can provide. https://t.co/6BKCagGp4d https://t.co/Ua1HFXZH20

.@antonioguterres calls for an immediate end to the fighting in Gaza and Israel, stressing that only a sustainable political solution will lead to lasting peace and reiterating his commitment to supporting Palestinians and Israelis to resolve the conflict.
https://t.co/qT0ieDr0aI

Despite living through six years of war, these children in Yemen are filled with hope.

And amid the world's worst humanitarian crisis, @WFP is working to ensure their future. 

Here's how you can help: https://t.co/E64f6BdbzK https://t.co/g4arLZcxdf

#FBF to December 2018 when Sir David Attenborough delivered the People's Seat address at the UN Climate Conference #COP24 in Poland. 

This year, Sir David will return to a UN Climate Conference as the #COP26 People's Advocate. https://t.co/c7fnsHeXXT https://t.co/kDu9XHB8gJ

In these 8 new Global Geoparks, @UNESCO is working hand in hand with local communities to celebrate our planet’s heritage and to build a better, more inclusive and more sustainable world for all. https://t.co/ne7yHsZEH7

https://t.co/UDKNomqZNF

The worldwide response to #COVID19 has demonstrated the power of solidarity. People are spreading kindness through their words & deeds -- while inspiring others to do the same.

No act of goodwill is too small in the fight against the pandemic.

🎨: Sarah Symes https://t.co/7hQcAb9xFN

School meals are often the only source of nutrition for millions of children.

Amid #COVID19, @WFP has continued to provide this life-saving assistance, including through take-home rations. https://t.co/SWnUQlqtjM https://t.co/TXpOBZ7ggS

Households consume 29% of global energy and contribute to 21% of CO2 emissions. 

Be a #ClimateAction hero - never waste electricity & always turn off the lights you don't need. https://t.co/nAjeCAHlAC #ActNow https://t.co/LPjJESq05Z

Only 13 countries have 50% or more women ministers & the number of countries with no women in government has increased.

See where your country stands on @UN_Women's 2021 Women in Politics map: https://t.co/b5Ecej0NhL https://t.co/R80iFMKWW4

"People really believe in the meaning of the UN emblem & flag. I can see hope in the eyes of children when we pass by." 

23-year-old Uruguayan Hector Prieto is one of the many young people with @UNPeacekeeping. 

Meet more women & men #ServingForPeace. ⬇️ https://t.co/YTLKyC2rD5

#COVID19 has created a global mental health crisis. 

Here are 4 tips for your mental health and ideas on how to help others who may need some extra support and care during the pandemic. 

More from @WHO during #MentalHealthMonth: https://t.co/kDphI8M633 https://t.co/L22gfvbZEr

Happy birthday to UN Messenger of Peace @StevieWonder!

Thank you for your tireless work to promote a more inclusive world for people with disabilities. https://t.co/XGtpdgRdVU

Too often, having a job doesn't guarantee a person can live a life of dignity, free from poverty. 

Sustainable economic growth & decent work for all are key to achieving the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/i7FUtD5ldB https://t.co/Bi4ZfafObu

Calling all young filmmakers! 📽️

The @PluralPlus Youth Video Festival is looking for original short films showcasing the benefits of migration, diversity, social inclusion, solidarity & more. 

Details: https://t.co/7lOi8xvVc6 #PLURALplus21 https://t.co/7KwQw9USu2

#OnlyTogether can we end this pandemic - by sharing the vaccine fairly around the world. 

More about the importance of ensuring that people around the world have access to #COVID19 vaccines, in our latest @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/zUfCLEwK1H

Thousands of families have fled their homes due to conflict in Ethiopia's Tigray region.
@Refugees is helping them with humanitarian aid, including clean water, food & shelter, but more support is needed.
See how you can help: https://t.co/astEgjia7G

https://t.co/IjZDYbgTGc

"Famine, disease & other miseries are not simply “happening” in Yemen. The war is imposing them. As long as the war continues, they will keep getting worse."

-- @UNReliefChief calls for a nationwide ceasefire amid world's worst humanitarian crisis. https://t.co/FwOZnLbWF3

To nurses everywhere: 
❤ Thank you for working around the clock to keep us safe during the #COVID19 crisis. 
❤ Thank you for making a difference every day.

On #InternationalNursesDay, @WHO explains how you can #SupportHealthCareWorkers: https://t.co/BQT2Jwa0v1 https://t.co/FnIGHxEYDk

عيد مبارك

#EidMubarak! 

Wishing all those who are celebrating a happy, safe and peaceful #EidalFitr! https://t.co/1zz9fwoGU3

Nurses should be able to work in a safe environment and have access to healthcare, especially when they are on the frontlines of the #COVID19 response.

Join us in thanking nurses everywhere on Wednesday's #InternationalNursesDay. https://t.co/xiQBakoEyq https://t.co/arO2jWpQCo

☀️ Solar-powered health centres in Dominica 
✅ Green employment in Mexico 
⚡️ Wastewater transformed into clean energy in Chile

People across Latin America & the Caribbean are taking #ClimateAction. https://t.co/3X5ZvM9veG

On Wednesday's #InternationalNursesDay, meet some of the amazing #WomenInScience who are working tirelessly to help the world tackle & recover from #COVID19. https://t.co/omQEq6H2X8 via @UN_Women https://t.co/AIkGER5xJB

"It's very important that we have a good number of women working in peace operations." 

-- @unmissmedia's Hiroko Hirahara talks about the importance of #WomenInPeacekeeping. https://t.co/EAePZexdPt https://t.co/76EhtA6why

Amid #COVID19, nurses around the world are showing courage & dedication and suffering personal sacrifice to care for others.  

Show solidarity on Wednesday's #InternationalNursesDay & every day. https://t.co/xiQBakGfpY https://t.co/cVXpIXRuAD

.@antonioguterres gravely concerned by serious escalations in the Occupied Palestinian Territory and Israel.
  
The UN is working to de-escalate the situation urgently. 
https://t.co/uMZN49fyKq

The global economy is projected to expand by 5.4% this year, but growth remains fragile in many countries.

Equitable access to #COVID19 vaccines around the world is key for a broad-based recovery. 

More in @UNDESA's latest #WorldEconomyReport: https://t.co/PHLOxSfEME https://t.co/RA07A4F5Il

"More than 100 days after the coup in Myanmar, the military authorities are showing no sign of letting up in their brutal crackdown on opponents in a bid to consolidate their hold on power."

-- @UNHumanRights spokesperson.
https://t.co/C9Rsyxtxz4

From wetland restoration 🌱 in Colombia to climate-smart agriculture🧑‍🌾in Guatemala, countries in Latin America & the Caribbean are stepping up their #ClimateAction with the help of @UNDP. 
https://t.co/4lwMiUE8P9

Refugees cannot be sent back home if their lives and safety will be at risk.

The 1951 Refugee Convention protects those forced to flee and helps uphold their human rights.

More from @Refugees: https://t.co/ZgsWpd1gKU https://t.co/bV9uUbdOEP

What does "net zero" greenhouse gas emissions mean & why is it important?

To limit global temperature rise and tackle the climate crisis, we need to cut emissions as close to zero as possible.

We can get to net zero if we take urgent #ClimateAction now. https://t.co/MSAJURN6nQ https://t.co/s50XuzH4yd

Based on our independent criminal investigations, @UNITAD_Iraq has established clear & convincing evidence that genocide was committed by ISIL against the Yazidis as a religious group.

-- @KarimKhanQC at Security Council. https://t.co/baWqtBeey4

It is crucial that these meetings in Glasgow, COP26, have success and that at last the nations will come together to solve the crippling problems that the world now faces.

-- #COP26 People's Advocate Sir David Attenborough calls for #ClimateAction. 

https://t.co/J3JEvPP68Y

During these times of high-stress and uncertainty amid the #COVID19 pandemic, it's important to look after yourself - and others.

Stay safe and stay positive. We are in this together -- and #OnlyTogether will we end the pandemic. #MentalHealthMonth

🎨: @Madwellington https://t.co/oZ6e3LTKW9

A generation of children in Yemen are growing up knowing only war.

@WFP is providing nutritious food to nearly 1 million children through its school feeding programme in areas hardest hit by the conflict. https://t.co/knWTdp62LW https://t.co/ZTt8c9CnVD

The Argan tree and its landscapes contribute to:
🔸 food security
🔸 nutrition
🔸 income generation
🔸 the livelihoods of rural communities

More from @FAO on Monday's first International Day of Argania: https://t.co/TeK9lrSqbM https://t.co/3s6XCBfRQC

To achieve a #ZeroHunger 🌎, we cannot leave anyone behind.
📽️ Here is how @FAO is helping Small Island Developing States, which are more vulnerable to natural disasters & often rely on imports due to limited natural resources. https://t.co/c0gFR2rXWM

https://t.co/51yxDikOhy

📸: The "Knotted Gun" sculpture, pictured here at UNHQ in NY, is an inspirational symbol of non-violence.

On Monday, the UN Conference on Disarmament starts at @UNGeneva.  Details: https://t.co/2RbxrHsblO https://t.co/e8FtthBTS6

Diversity is a strength, not a threat. 

Yet, racism is a problem in every country. 

See how each of us can #StandUp4HumanRights, and help #FightRacism, discrimination & hatred: https://t.co/Ijz1XWpOD8 https://t.co/G1mvbrgGHR

The argan tree is a native species of Morocco. 

By supporting income generation and increasing climate resilience & adaptation, it plays an important role in achieving the #GlobalGoals. 

More on Monday's first ever International Day of Argania: https://t.co/tjQ38YtfcW

"The move from polluting to renewable energy must be a just transition involving local governments, unions & the private sector to support affected communities & people, generating green jobs."  

-- @antonioguterres stressed earlier this week. #PCD12 https://t.co/q7cZwRYC9k

Amid the pandemic, it is completely normal to feel anxious, isolated or overwhelmed, but we are in this together -- and #OnlyTogether will we get through it.

May is #MentalHealthMonth.

🎨: @UN_Women https://t.co/HK5Y9Mg1K3

Last year, fewer than 23,000 refugees were resettled around the world.

UNHCR welcomes this week's decision by the USA to admit up to 62,500 people this year under the refugee resettlement programme in an act of solidarity. via @Refugees 

https://t.co/jQpuaDWg7O

Clean energy is good business: 
It drives more jobs, cleaner air & better health.

A swift transition to sustainable energy is critically important to tackle the global climate crisis. https://t.co/Nvl0LyI1N0 #ClimateAction https://t.co/mXQrTKObka

#COVID has left many health centres struggling to fulfill every mother's right to give birth safely.

This #MothersDay🌹, @UNFPA is calling for increased training & support of midwives so they can fulfill their crucial role helping new mums and their babies. https://t.co/oOnJOQPCsU

Methane is a an extremely powerful greenhouse gas that causes over one million pre-mature deaths per year.

@UNEP explains how methane can be reduced quickly and cost-effectively, in order to benefit the climate & air quality: https://t.co/rLlJWl0Yxv https://t.co/6r1r0oAsSi

After the Second World War, the UN was established to save succeeding generations from the scourge of war. 

Today, our work continues amid the #COVID19 pandemic & other global challenges. https://t.co/r1eVpvprcS #WWII https://t.co/AgVFOWJTbM

Mothers have shouldered the burden of the #COVID19 pandemic, braving all odds to protect their children. 

In crisis after crisis, mothers around the world are asked to do the impossible

This #MothersDay, we salute you. https://t.co/7DCebfiCxY via @UNFPA https://t.co/JV3jdZQl6g

On Saturday at 8pm EST, @GlblCtzn #VaxLive concert is sending an urgent message: Everyone, everywhere deserves access to a #COVID19 vaccine. 

#OnlyTogether can we beat this pandemic. https://t.co/srZ3njuYsL

Happy birthday Sir David Attenborough!

And thank you for your tireless commitment to #ClimateAction. 

Here's how you can join him in protecting our planet: https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV https://t.co/LAwDq7w2qF

20% of bird species migrate to find food & to breed. 

They provide multiple benefits, such as seed dispersal & pollination.

Yet, the degradation of nature increasingly threatens migrating birds. More on Saturday’s #WorldMigratoryBirdDay: https://t.co/jgct0IukG7 https://t.co/FAU7re2gup

Acute food insecurity has soared to a 5-year high, with 155 million people relying on humanitarian assistance to survive.

@WFP scaling up operations & using cutting-edge technology to identify hunger hotspots, but more support is needed to #FightFamine. https://t.co/E0O5zGKInE https://t.co/kO3v61jsDw

Saturday's #WorldMigratoryBirdDay highlights the need for international action to protect migratory birds. 

YOU can also help by:

🌿 making your garden bird-friendly
🦩 learning about birds 
♻️ reducing plastic pollution

More ideas: https://t.co/jgct0ILVxF https://t.co/SMnNGS4tyq
Join us in honouring those who lost their lives during the Second World War during this week's time of remembrance. https://t.co/RuuMl2NuF2 #WWII https://t.co/y5JKo3VfnQ

Saturday's #WorldMigratoryBirdDay is an opportunity to connect with nature by actively listening to & watching birds.

See how you can help protect these unique species: https://t.co/jgct0ILVxF https://t.co/nEvToX3UVi

#OnlyTogether can we bring the #COVID19 pandemic to an end. 

Here are some inspiring examples of solidarity and humanity in our latest @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/V4kbA1nkiT

As global ambassadors of nature, migratory birds connect people & countries.

On Saturday's #WorldMigratoryBirdDay, let's commit to protecting birds & the habitats they need to survive. https://t.co/jgct0IukG7 https://t.co/htm3SjQxFW

Physical distancing during #COVID19 does not have to mean social or emotional isolation.

📲 Stay connected with your family & friends.

We are in this together & we will get through this together.

🎨: @byrawpixel https://t.co/RPDKa1Xg85

"We call on Israel to immediately halt all forced evictions." 

-- @UNHumanRights spokesperson, also calling for respect of freedom of expression & assembly, and maximum restraint in the use of force while ensuring safety & security in East Jerusalem.
https://t.co/IR2sXAjPEB
Starting soon: #UNGA informal dialogue with @antonioguterres as candidate for second term as UN Secretary-General. Watch at https://t.co/WhwXXmCYWf https://t.co/Fd4RmJJlkF

Decent work means dignity, equality, a fair income & safe working conditions. 

The #GlobalGoals aim to achieve full & productive employment for all by 2030.  https://t.co/SPeQ3D9HDu https://t.co/V6gKozUkLl

"Sexual violence has been used in every war, in every conflict, as a tactic of war."

In latest episode of Awake At Night, UN special representative for @endrapeinwar Pramila Patten talks about her work with survivors of conflict-related sexual violence. https://t.co/KSRFmCcQrm https://t.co/EWcaxJDykA

200,000+ cargo ship crew members are stranded at sea beyond their contracts due to #COVID19. 

New UN guidelines aim to protecting seafarers' human rights amid the pandemic. https://t.co/MNbda43HZy

As the Tigray crisis worsens, the UN has allocated $65 million to support the humanitarian response in Ethiopia, where more than 16 million people need humanitarian assistance. via @UNOCHA
https://t.co/TCjMmy5ASh

The @IntlCrimCourt sentences former commander of the Lord's Resistance Army in Uganda - who has been found guilty of 61 crimes against humanity & war crimes - to 25 years in prison. https://t.co/w7lWrCyNhc

UN leaders welcome decision by the USA to lift patent protections for #COVID19 vaccines.

Move will allow vaccine producers to share knowledge & technology to help boost global supply of life-saving vaccines. https://t.co/fKXntAkvXr

Let us use the #COVID19 pandemic recovery and #COP26 to promote a safe and sustainable future for all nations and people.

-- @antonioguterres calls for urgent #ClimateAction at Petersberg Climate Dialogue. https://t.co/F9XKNuYSKx #PCD12 https://t.co/E3scFCnALc

Human-caused methane emissions are rising. We must reduce them by at least 45% by 2030 to address the climate emergency.

New Global Methane Assessment from @CCACoalition & @UNEP shows how governments and industry can cut methane. ➡️ https://t.co/rLlJWkJnFX https://t.co/C4wBinfvyM

We live in a world in desperate need of healing & hope. The UN represents a measure of that hope. The colleagues we honour today helped bring that hope to life.

- @antonioguterres remembers fallen UN staff members & their efforts to create a better world. https://t.co/wmvVR2CLaR https://t.co/30o8L5821g

"When women are part of @UNPeacekeeping, they open doors so that women are respected & treated equally in government, in civil society & among the population."

-- @unmissmedia's Anu Melkko on the importance of senior #WomenInPeacekeeping. https://t.co/EAePZefCXV https://t.co/kRn0Y36xcc

2021 is the Int'l Year of Health & Care Workers.

Health heroes are key in the fight against #COVID19 & essential to ensure #HealthForAll. They must be supported, protected & equipped to deliver safe health care at all times.

More from @WHO: https://t.co/BQT2JvSp6r https://t.co/wYf4CY4cmO

"There will be new variants as long as we are unable to contain this pandemic." 

— Dr Aboubacar Kampo, Director of Health Programmes at @UNICEF on the urgent need to improve equitable access to #COVID19 vaccines around the world. https://t.co/lsfaV8no4k https://t.co/k72PZnKh5O
Myanmar: Repeated attacks on medical personnel & facilities in the country, as well as arrests of doctors are endangering vital health services & #COVID19 response. https://t.co/DNqK8ekQU3

USA: Laws aimed at suppressing racial justice protests & #BlackLivesMatter movement may violate international law protecting right to peaceful assembly, says independent @UNHumanRights expert. https://t.co/zChRbHI853

At least 155 million people faced crisis levels of food insecurity in 2020 - an increase of 20 million compared to 2019.

Conflict, extreme weather & economic shocks related to #COVID19 are all contributing to staggering number of hungry people worldwide. https://t.co/Ot0xXwgsjj https://t.co/Qu3mCUOZZO

Midwives are fundamental to ending preventable maternal & newborn deaths, yet the world is facing a shortage of 900,000 of these essential providers.  

@WHO says investing in midwives could save up to 4.3 million lives annually. https://t.co/tZ3JdkQYWd #DayoftheMidwife https://t.co/aLBJMkNk0c

People with asthma are at increased risk of severe #COVID19.

This common lung condition can't be cured, but inhaled medications can enable patients to enjoy a normal, active life.

More 🗝️ facts from @WHO on Wednesday's #WorldAsthmaDay: https://t.co/Q2flnJ71h4 https://t.co/FiPd7GWQBL

Wednesday is African World Heritage Day - an opportunity to learn more about & celebrate the indispensable tools that Africa’s rich & diverse heritage offers us all. 

More from @UNESCO: https://t.co/N5bHDWVSee https://t.co/o94MeaT9Rq

Despite the uncertainty of #COVID19, midwives have continued to provide an invaluable service to their communities.

On Wednesday's #DayoftheMidwife, @UNFPA calls for greater investments in midwifery to ensure access to maternal healthcare for all. https://t.co/o3tNkPepNf https://t.co/rYcP12iU3C

Clean hands save lives in seconds by:
✅ preventing infection 
✅ helping combat #COVID19 & many other diseases 

More from @WHO on Wednesday's World #HandHygiene Day: https://t.co/zSf6UCyMif https://t.co/UfmTqoRxzo

Wednesday is Portuguese Language Day!

Follow @NacoesUnidas for social media updates in Portuguese, a language spoken by 260 million people around the world. 

More from @UNESCO. https://t.co/dznkzOUlN5 https://t.co/iGqZB6hN0U

"It is essential that we work together - across borders, sectors and disciplines - to make science and technology work for everyone."

-- @antonioguterres about the importance of science and innovation for our well-being and survival. 
https://t.co/PeClb2vGZN

Despite overstretched healthcare systems due to #COVID19, midwives have continued to provide essential medical services to mothers & newborns around the world.

On the #DayOfTheMidwife, join us in thanking them for their courage & commitment. https://t.co/o3tNkPw0EN via @UNFPA https://t.co/R2W161rgtl

Hand washing is key to protect yourself & others from #COVID19 & many other diseases. Yet, nearly 3 billion people lack soap & water at home.

On Wednesday's #HandHygiene Day, help mobilize action for access to hand hygiene for all: https://t.co/19x7J6MpN4 https://t.co/zvzMbB7NeF

It's normal to feel sad, lonely or overwhelmed during times of high stress such as the #COVID19 pandemic. 

But physical distance does not have to mean social isolation. 

May is #MentalHealthMonth. via @UN_Women https://t.co/mB7th6RQog

🕊 Young people are powerful agents of peace who can help prevent & resolve conflict around the world. 

Yet, youth must be listened to & supported to fulfill this crucial role. 

More from @UNPeacekeeping: https://t.co/ipEvGM3zUC #YouthPeaceSecurity https://t.co/0E6HEIpAgo

🌊 Sea levels are rising.
⚠️ Sea-ice is retreating.
🌀 Extreme weather events are becoming more frequent & intense.

The climate emergency is an existential threat and people who have been forced to flee their homes are on the frontlines. via @Refugees https://t.co/gVHGPOFX8Y

From recovering better from #COVID19 to achieving the #GlobalGoals, science-based solutions can help solve some of the biggest challenges today. 

The UN's 6th annual Science, Technology & Innovation Forum starts Tuesday. https://t.co/YeR5xCJ2M4 https://t.co/6eVKXDwvY0

Youth advocates from around the world will share solutions to drive local action for strengthening the future of food during Tuesday's @FoodSystems Global Youth Summit Dialogue. https://t.co/cexJCnMRgc https://t.co/rnJpNJP3in

People become refugees not by choice, but forced by circumstances.

Resettlement in another country is a life-saving option available for only the most vulnerable among them. 

More from @Refugees: https://t.co/TvleUFbkIH https://t.co/fqIArpGYSb

UN economists: Pandemic has caused dramatic rise of e-commerce, while some pre-pandemic big-hitters have seen a reversal of their fortunes in the last year. 
https://t.co/nkSg7ZNOLp via @UNCTAD

After just 3 months, the latest #Ebola outbreak in the Democratic Republic of the Congo has been declared over. 

@WHO says the swift response of the country's health care system helped limit the outbreak to just 12 cases. https://t.co/vrrpWcRbbs https://t.co/AOG7GpGekd

Women journalists are often harassed, abused & threatened just for doing their jobs.

More must be done to protect women journalists from online violence.

Monday is #WorldPressFreedomDay. 

https://t.co/xsbjwpkC0n via @UNESCO https://t.co/CVrYS06qPW
